enrollValidator(uint32,address).details: Reverts if `_validator` is already in the validator set.

params._domain: The remote domain of the validator set.
params._validator: The validator to add to the validator set.

enrollValidators(uint32[],address[][]).details: Reverts if `_validator` is already in the validator set._validators[i] are the validators to enroll for _domains[i].

params._domains: The remote domains of the validator sets.
params._validators: The validators to add to the validator sets.

params._address: The address to test for set membership.
params._domain: The remote domain of the validator set.

returns._0: True if the address is enrolled, false otherwise.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._domain: The remote domain of the validator set.

params._domains: The remote domains of the validator sets.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unenrollValidator(uint32,address).details: Reverts if `_validator` is not in the validator set.

params._domain: The remote domain of the validator set.
params._validator: The validator to remove from the validator set.

params._domain: The remote domain of the validator set.

returns._0: The number of validators enrolled in the validator set.

params._domain: The remote domain of the validator set.

returns._0: The addresses of the validator set.

validatorsAndThreshold(bytes).details: Can change based on the content of _message

returns._0: validators The array of validator addresses
returns._1: threshold The number of validator signatures needed

params.commitment: A commitment to the validator set and threshold.
params.domain: The remote domain of the validator set.
The remote domain of the validator set.
The remote domain of the validator set.
params.validatorCount: The number of enrolled validators in the validator set.

params.validatorCount: The number of enrolled validators in the validator set.

commitment(uint32).notice: A succinct commitment to the validator set and threshold for each remote domain.

enrollValidator(uint32,address).notice: Enrolls a validator into a validator set.

enrollValidators(uint32[],address[][]).notice: Enrolls multiple validators into a validator set.

isEnrolled(uint32,address).notice: Returns whether an address is enrolled in a validator set.

moduleType().notice: Returns an enum that represents the type of security model encoded by this ISM.

setThresholds(uint32[],uint8[]).notice: Sets the quorum threshold for multiple domains.

threshold(uint32).notice: The validator threshold for each remote domain.

unenrollValidator(uint32,address).notice: Unenrolls a validator from a validator set.

validatorCount(uint32).notice: Returns the number of validators enrolled in the validator set.

validatorsAndThreshold(bytes).notice: Returns the set of validators responsible for verifying _message and the number of signatures required

verify(bytes,bytes).notice: Verifies that a quorum of the origin domain's validators signed a checkpoint, and verifies the merkle proof of `_message` against that checkpoint.

CommitmentUpdated(uint32,bytes32).notice: Emitted when the validator set or threshold changes.

ThresholdSet(uint32,uint8).notice: Emitted when the quorum threshold is set.

ValidatorEnrolled(uint32,address,uint256.notice: Emitted when a validator is enrolled in a validator set.

ValidatorUnenrolled(uint32,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when a validator is unenrolled from a validator set.

userdoc.notice: Manages an ownable set of validators that ECDSA sign checkpoints to reach a quorum.
